content:
• Wednesday, September 12, 2012
  • PLL-OLD

    Pall (NYSE:PLL-OLD): FQ4 EPS of $0.73 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $783.7M (+0.4% Y/Y) beats by...

    Pall (NYSE:PLL-OLD): FQ4 EPS of $0.73 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $783.7M (+0.4% Y/Y) beats by $65M. Shares +4.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 PM
  • LRN

    K12 (NYSE:LRN): FQ4 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $170.4M (+32.8% Y/Y) beats by $5M....

    K12 (NYSE:LRN): FQ4 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $170.4M (+32.8% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Shares +2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:52 PM
  • SEH

    Spartech (NYSE:SEH): FQ3 EPS of $0.08 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $282.4M (-3% Y/Y) misses by...

    Spartech (NYSE:SEH): FQ3 EPS of $0.08 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $282.4M (-3% Y/Y) misses by $15M. Shares -8.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA +10%) closed up strongly in the wake of Mark Zuckerberg's TechCrunch Disrupt talk...

    Zynga (ZNGA +10%) closed up strongly in the wake of Mark Zuckerberg's TechCrunch Disrupt talk (I, II). Zuck gave Zynga a favorable mention during his talk, but also didn't cover any new ground, and admitted Zynga has lost Facebook gaming share. With Zynga shorts staring at giant profits, a short-covering rally may have been overdue. Earlier today, Zynga announced it would release two mobile role-playing games developed by its Japanese unit, Montopia and Ayakashi, to global audiences.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM
  • GWR

    Genesee & Wyoming (NYSE:GWR) -4.4% AH after announcing a public offering of 3.5M common...

    Genesee & Wyoming (NYSE:GWR) -4.4% AH after announcing a public offering of 3.5M common shares and 2M tangible equity units through Bank of America, Citi and JPMorgan. GWR intends to use the net proceeds to partially fund its acquisition of RailAmerica or for general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM
  • SHW

    Valspar (VAL) declares $0.20/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield...

    Valspar (VAL) declares $0.20/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield 1.40%. For shareholders of record Oct 01. Payable Oct 15. Ex-div date Sep 27. Shares -2.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM

  • Millennial Media (MM +11.8%) posted huge gains after Canaccord pounded the table for the mobile...

    Millennial Media (MM +11.8%) posted huge gains after Canaccord pounded the table for the mobile display ad network owner. After hosting investor meetings with CFO Mike Avon, Canaccord argues "there is room for increased sponsorship" of Millennial shares, which finally closed above their $13 IPO price after spending weeks below. The firm also declared Millennial "the cleanest way to play growth in mobile advertising."

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • PSTI

    Pluristem Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PSTI) says it intends to offer an undisclosed sum of common stock...

    Pluristem Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PSTI) says it intends to offer an undisclosed sum of common stock and warrants. Jefferies is acting as sole book-running manager, with Oppenheimer acting as co-lead. The company plans to use the funds to conduct clinical trials, research and product development activities and for general corporate purposes. Shares -11.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • DSW

    DSW (NYSE:DSW) declared special dividend of $2.00/share. For shareholders of record Oct 16....

    DSW (NYSE:DSW) declared special dividend of $2.00/share. For shareholders of record Oct 16. Payable Oct 26. Ex-div date Oct 12. The company had earlier declared regular quarterly dividend of $0.18/share, in line with previous. Forward yield 1.12%. For shareholders of record Sep 18. Payable Sep 28. Ex-div date Sep 14. Shares +1.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • TWO

    Two Harbors Investment (NYSE:TWO) declares $0.36/share quarterly dividend, 10% decrease from...

    Two Harbors Investment (NYSE:TWO) declares $0.36/share quarterly dividend, 10% decrease from prior dividend of $0.40. Forward yield 12.1%. For shareholders of record Sep 24. Payable Oct 22. Ex-div date Sep 20. Shares -1.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 7 Comments
  • SNTS

    Stifel Nicolaus ups its target from $8 to $11 on Santarus (SNTS +5%) on the back of its highly...

    Stifel Nicolaus ups its target from $8 to $11 on Santarus (SNTS +5%) on the back of its highly successful Phase 3 results for Rifamycin SV MMX in traveler’s diarrhea, and it's successful appeal against Par Pharmaceuticals (NYSE:PRX). The firm thinks that Zegerid will gain an extra $35M-$45M in annual sales as a result of the court decision, and it maintains a Buy rating on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • TMH

    Medical staffing company Team Health Holding (TMH -6.6%) slides after a principal stockholder...

    Medical staffing company Team Health Holding (TMH -6.6%) slides after a principal stockholder offers 8M shares for sale at $28.05, a 4.5% discount to Tuesday's close. Ensemble Health, the selling shareholder, is an affiliate of the Blackstone Group (BX +1.5%), which trimmed its stake down from about 54% two months ago and now owns roughly a 39% stake in the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • VMC

    Shares of Vulcan Materials (VMC +9.8%) and Martin Marietta (MLM +3.9%) soar, as rumors of a...

    Shares of Vulcan Materials (VMC +9.8%) and Martin Marietta (MLM +3.9%) soar, as rumors of a hostile takeover are seen as less likely to come to fruition since business has improved at VMC. Susquehanna says MLM would have to raise any bid above the prior 0.5 exchange ratio, and a takeover would face antitrust risk due to an overlapping market.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM
  • CIG

    Shares of Brazilian electric utilities plunge a day after the country announced a major cut in...

    Shares of Brazilian electric utilities plunge a day after the country announced a major cut in electricity taxes that will lower energy costs for industries and consumers. UBS says the “stock-price declines on regulatory noise seem exaggerated,” presenting buying opportunities. CIG -20.8%, ELP -8.9%, EBR -7.9%, CPL -3.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 3 Comments
  • MTG

    MGIC Investment (MTG -5.2%) tumbles after announcing its intent to defer an interest...

    MGIC Investment (MTG -5.2%) tumbles after announcing its intent to defer an interest payment on $389.5M of convertible debt until 2022 (as it's allowed). The move frees up cash for the company as it continues to deal with losses, litigation, and regulatory action. The company last deferred a payment in 2010. (8-K)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • NES

    Heckmann (HEK +8.9%) shares power higher despite no news to explain the move, although the...

    Heckmann (HEK +8.9%) shares power higher despite no news to explain the move, although the hydro-fracking water solutions provider might be seeing some upside from Chesapeake's (CHK -0.8%) asset sales. HEK said CHK accounted for 25% of its total revenues in 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 3 Comments
  • DOLE

    Dole (DOLE +11%) jumps on reports that it's ready to sell two of its businesses - its global...

    Dole (DOLE +11%) jumps on reports that it's ready to sell two of its businesses - its global canned fruit and juice beverage processing operations and its Asian fruit and vegetable business - to Japanese trading house Itochu (OTCPK:ITOCY) for around $1.7B. The deal could be completed during the current FY.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • P

    Pandora (P +5.3%) is spiking higher as Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) announces an iTunes overhaul without...

    Pandora (P +5.3%) is spiking higher as Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) announces an iTunes overhaul without saying anything about a new Internet radio service, the subject of a Sep. 7 WSJ report (I, II) that crushed Pandora's shares. However, it's worth pointing out the WSJ scoop cautioned Apple's service could be months away, given the company had only recently begun licensing talks with studios.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • ANF

    Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF +5.9%) waives the Goldman flag, hiring the investment firm to...

    Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF +5.9%) waives the Goldman flag, hiring the investment firm to advise it on its options as it sits mired in a slump. Large investors loudly calling for something dramatic from the retailer got their wish. Shares +5% in minutes off of the news.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • NTR

    Citi upgrades Agrium (AGU +2%) to Buy, believing nitrogen demand will be strong in the coming...

    Citi upgrades Agrium (AGU +2%) to Buy, believing nitrogen demand will be strong in the coming year as farmers prepare for a rebound in the corn harvest and demand for ag retail products will be strong. But in cutting Potash (POT -1.6%) to Neutral, Citi says India and China remain a risk to the market, and it sees flat potash prices through next year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM

  • Demandware (DWRE +9.3%) takes off after Janney starts coverage with a Buy and $35 target. After...

    Demandware (DWRE +9.3%) takes off after Janney starts coverage with a Buy and $35 target. After tumbling earlier this summer on concerns about high European sales exposure, shares of the e-commerce software provider are now within striking distance of their post-IPO high, aided by a strong Q2 report. Over 17% of Demandware's float was shorted as of Aug. 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • KKR

    KKR, Apollo Global (NYSE:APO), and Clayton Dubilier & Rice are considering a buyout of KAR...

    KKR, Apollo Global (NYSE:APO), and Clayton Dubilier & Rice are considering a buyout of KAR Auction (KAR +1%) in what potentially could be a $4B deal. The discussion is in the early stages, after KAR hired Evercore Partners to solicit offers. A deal may be hard to come by however, as KAR's price has been rallying on buyout chatter and skewing the math. The stock is up more than 10% since August 22, when news of a potential sale broke.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • AGPPY

    Anglo American Platinum (OTCPK:AGPPY -2.7%) says it is suspending operations at its Rustenburg...

    Anglo American Platinum (OTCPK:AGPPY -2.7%) says it is suspending operations at its Rustenburg platinum mines in South Africa to protect the safety and security of its employees from outside intimidation. The mines are located in the same area where 45 people have died so far in a month-long wildcat strike.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • BAESY

    BAE Systems (OTCPK:BAESY +11.2%) and Airbus (OTCPK:EADSY -5.2%) confirm they are in discussions...

    BAE Systems (OTCPK:BAESY +11.2%) and Airbus (OTCPK:EADSY -5.2%) confirm they are in discussions regarding a possible combination of their businesses through the creation of a dual listed company structure, under which both companies would operate as one group, but would be separately listed on their existing exchanges. The combination shapes up so that BAE Systems shareholders would own 40% and EADS shareholders 60% respectively of the enlarged group.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • EXC

    Exelon (EXC -2.6%) is downgraded by UBS to Sell from Neutral with a $31 price target (from $37)...

    Exelon (EXC -2.6%) is downgraded by UBS to Sell from Neutral with a $31 price target (from $37) on "weakening power prices of late and heat rates across PJM... concerns around retail margin compression given, and downside to robust consensus EPS expectations following management's Q2 O&M (implicitly higher) guidance." Citi tagged EXC with a Sell rating earlier this week.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM | 1 Comment

  • Tangoe (TNGO +4.9%) rallies after Raymond James (Strong Buy) once more defends the company...

    Tangoe (TNGO +4.9%) rallies after Raymond James (Strong Buy) once more defends the company (previous) in the face of bearish reports from The Street Sweeper and Copperfield Research. RJ calls the attacks unsubstantiated and asserts Tangoe, whose organic growth was questioned in the reports, is in fact posting 20%+ top-line growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake (CHK -1.1%) swings sharply lower after its opening pop, as analysts question whether...

    Chesapeake (CHK -1.1%) swings sharply lower after its opening pop, as analysts question whether it got top dollar for the Permian Basin acreage; some had expected the sales to reap $4B-$5B (I, II, III). The deal has "helped them climb up the wall in this hole they've dug for themselves, but they are not there yet," Argus' Phil Weiss says.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 5 Comments
  • PHM

    PulteGroup (PHM +5.7%) gains after Williams Financial Group upped the shares to Buy earlier...

    PulteGroup (PHM +5.7%) gains after Williams Financial Group upped the shares to Buy earlier today, and increased its price target to $17 from $13. The firm cites better operational metrics and in-line new order growth combined with the substantial move-up segment sales improvements, adding that PHM seems to be finally realizing the benefits from its ongoing strategy to drive improvements through its existing communities while controlling costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM | 2 Comments

  • Shares of Office Depot (ODP +16.4%) soar to new heights on heavy volume as the office supply...

    Shares of Office Depot (ODP +16.4%) soar to new heights on heavy volume as the office supply seller hits its highest levels since early July. Last week, the company issued positive comments on sales but today's rally looks more like a momentum run.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM

  • Synaptics (SYNA -6.3%) tumbles on a downgrade to Hold from Needham's Rajvindra Gill. Like so...

    Synaptics (SYNA -6.3%) tumbles on a downgrade to Hold from Needham's Rajvindra Gill. Like so much recent negative tech commentary, Gill's downgrade revolves around PC demand: he thinks poor notebook sales puts Synaptics' Dec. quarter estimates at risk, given the market accounts for ~50% of the company's sales. This, along with weak pricing and a mix shift in the mobile phone touch controller market, is expected to offset Synaptics' early lead in the in-cell touch controller space.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM

  • Shares of Monster Beverage (MNST -5.3%) fall to monthly lows as the takeover rumors start to...

    Shares of Monster Beverage (MNST -5.3%) fall to monthly lows as the takeover rumors start to fizzle once again. The company is also seeing competition intensify in the energy drink market with Starbucks Refreshers making a decent splash over the late summer.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 1 Comment

  • STEC (STEC -5.5%) dives after disclosing PricewaterhouseCoopers has resigned as the company's...

    STEC (STEC -5.5%) dives after disclosing PricewaterhouseCoopers has resigned as the company's auditor at its own choosing. PwC's resignation comes less than two months after CEO Manouchechr Moshayedi was charged with insider trading over an '09 stock offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • NOK

    Some European tech names are higher in early trading after rallying across the pond in the wake...

    Some European tech names are higher in early trading after rallying across the pond in the wake of a favorable German Constitutional Court ruling. NOK +2.5%. STM +4.9%. ALU +3.5%. ASMI +2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • VLO

    Valero Energy (VLO +2.1%) moves up after Morgan Stanley upgraded the shares to Overweight this...

    Valero Energy (VLO +2.1%) moves up after Morgan Stanley upgraded the shares to Overweight this morning, citing optimism over the current refining cycle. The firm believes the trend will continue into the next fiscal year, and multiples will continue to re-rate at least through H2 2013.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • BIDU

    In addition to Sohu, Citi is also giving a lift to Youku Tudou (YOKU +4.1%) by launchng coverage...

    In addition to Sohu, Citi is also giving a lift to Youku Tudou (YOKU +4.1%) by launchng coverage with a Buy. Qihoo (QIHU +1.5%), meanwhile, is benefiting from Citi's reiteration of a Buy, and from positive comments from ThinkEquity: the firm likes the revenue potential of Qihoo's ad deal with Google, and predicts Qihoo will continue taking search share from Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM

  • Powerwave (PWAV +71.1%) skyrockets after reaching a credit agreement with private P-Wave...

    Powerwave (PWAV +71.1%) skyrockets after reaching a credit agreement with private P-Wave Holdings that could save the troubled base station amplifier maker from bankruptcy. P-Wave has lent $35M to Powerwave, will provide another $15M upon request, and will consider requests for up to $100M more. As part of the deal, P-Wave receives warrants to purchase 2.625M Powerwave shares at a price of $0.50/share; following today's move, Powerwave is changing hands at $0.653.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM

  • Shares of Furniture Brands (FBN +14.0%) surge with an article out from SA author Trade in Mexico...

    Shares of Furniture Brands (FBN +14.0%) surge with an article out from SA author Trade in Mexico noting that the stock looks ripe for a run off of either a housing turnaround or short squeeze. A report that mortgage applications were up 11% last week could be the signal that the squeeze play is on.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • MDR

    McDermott (MDR +3.3%) is started at Buy with a $16 target at Global Hunter, which views MDR as a...

    McDermott (MDR +3.3%) is started at Buy with a $16 target at Global Hunter, which views MDR as a "pure play leverage to the burgeoning global offshore development cycle." The firm likes MDR's "building visibility in the form of bids outstanding, a robust backlog and sound underlying end-market dynamics related to robust oil prices and impressive offshore exploration successes."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • BPR

    General Growth Properties (GGP -1.5%) expects FY12 FFO of $0.96/share - below consensus...

    General Growth Properties (GGP -1.5%) expects FY12 FFO of $0.96/share - below consensus expectations for $0.97 - according to its presentation at the Barclays Financial Services Conference. The company says new store opening plans at its malls are at a 4-year high, with international retailers a particular strength.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM

  • Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +0.6%) trade higher after peer Coffee Holdings...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +0.6%) trade higher after peer Coffee Holdings smashes the estimates of analysts with its FQ3 report by improving its gross margin by 300 bps. GMCR typically pulls JVA up on momentum-fueled trading days, so perhaps today JVA will return the favor.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM

  • Facebook (FB +4.9%) shoots higher in response to Mark Zuckerberg's remarks, which included...

    Facebook (FB +4.9%) shoots higher in response to Mark Zuckerberg's remarks, which included strong hints Facebook will build a search engine. Google (GOOG -0.7%) is slipping even though tech is up. Should Facebook get involved in search, Google would still have a giant user base, billions in invested R&D, and mountains of query data on its side. But Facebook's own user data and huge share of Web usage could nonetheless make it a legit competitor. And even moderate share gains from Facebook could dent Google's search ad pricing. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM | 16 Comments

  • Coffee Holdings (JVA +17.8%) soars after beating the estimate of analysts with its earnings...

    Coffee Holdings (JVA +17.8%) soars after beating the estimate of analysts with its earnings report. The firm's 24% Y/Y jump in revenue was led by strong demand for green coffee as well as improved sales of private label and branded products.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM
  • HK

    Halcon Resources (NYSE:HK) -5.8% premarket after announcing a secondary offering of 35M shares...

    Halcon Resources (NYSE:HK) -5.8% premarket after announcing a secondary offering of 35M shares of its common stock offered by EnCap Energy Capital, with a 30-day option to purchase up to 5.25M additional shares. EnCap owns ~32% of HK shares. HK will not receive any proceeds from the offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • TST

    TheStreet (NASDAQ:TST) +5% on news it has acquired The Deal, owner of M&A news site The Deal...

    TheStreet (NASDAQ:TST) +5% on news it has acquired The Deal, owner of M&A news site The Deal Pipeline, for an undisclosed sum. The Deal claims 40K subs, many of whom are financial professionals, and churns out 100+ articles/day. TheStreet plans to integrate some of its content on The Deal, and to cross-sell The Deal to its existing readers/customers. The Deal's magazine will be shuttered. A CC to discuss the purchase starts at 10AM ET (webcast).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • ONCY

    Oncolytics Biotech (NASDAQ:ONCY) -13.4% premarket after saying it will expand enrollment in its...

    Oncolytics Biotech (NASDAQ:ONCY) -13.4% premarket after saying it will expand enrollment in its Phase III study of Reolysin, a possible treatment for head and neck cancers, after observing different responses in two different groups of patients.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: European shares and U.S. futures are broadly higher after Germany's...

    Market preview: European shares and U.S. futures are broadly higher after Germany's Constitutional Court rules that the ESM is legal, with the S&P benchmark +0.4%. Next up is the FOMC, which starts its two-day policy meeting and is expected to announce another liquidity rush at the end of it. Facebook +7% after Mark Zuckerberg's pep talk yesterday soothes some nerves. Later: Apple iPhone frenzy
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • CYOU

    Sohu (NASDAQ:SOHU) +3.7% after Citi starts coverage with a Buy and uses a sum-of-the-parts...

    Sohu (NASDAQ:SOHU) +3.7% after Citi starts coverage with a Buy and uses a sum-of-the-parts analysis to value the company at $63.70, 55% above current levels. The recent showdown between Qihoo and Baidu's search engines highlights the value of Sohu's Sogou engine and input software, Citi argues, and the company's Changyou (NASDAQ:CYOU) subsidiary is an "innovator" in a crowded Chinese online gaming market. (Citron Research)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • SSRX

    3SBio (NASDAQ:SSRX) says it received a going-private proposal from its Chairman and CEO for...

    3SBio (NASDAQ:SSRX) says it received a going-private proposal from its Chairman and CEO for $15/share, a 29% premium to yesterday's closing price. The acquisition would be financed through a combination of debt and equity capital, with a financial institution having expressed interest in financing the deal. Shares +20.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • MEDW

    Premarket gainers: MEDW +39%. SSRX +21%. JVA +18%. NBG +13%. FB +7%. YOKU +6%. NOK +6%. AUO +5%....

    Premarket gainers: MEDW +39%. SSRX +21%. JVA +18%. NBG +13%. FB +7%. YOKU +6%. NOK +6%. AUO +5%.
    Losers: GCOM -19%. ONCY -18%. OTC:PURE -16%. XRTX -15%. MTG -11%. CIG -11%. HK -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • AEO

    Shares of American Eagle Outfitters (NYSE:AEO) gain 3.9% in premarket trading after the company...

    Shares of American Eagle Outfitters (NYSE:AEO) gain 3.9% in premarket trading after the company announces a special $1.50 per share dividend.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM

  • Corn tumbles 2% as the USDA lowers its expected crop yield and harvest only marginally from last...

    Corn tumbles 2% as the USDA lowers its expected crop yield and harvest only marginally from last month's estimates. Also lowered were expected exports - to 1.25B bushels from the already low figure of 1.3B. As a result, new crop ending stocks are now estimated at 733M bushels, up from 650M.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • VNR

    Vanguard Natural Resources (NYSE:VNR) -4.4% premarket after announcing a public offering of 6M...

    Vanguard Natural Resources (NYSE:VNR) -4.4% premarket after announcing a public offering of 6M common units at $27.51 each, representing limited liability company interests. Net proceeds will be used to pay down outstanding debt under VNR’s senior secured revolving credit facility.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM | 7 Comments
  • TOO

    Teekay Offshore Partners (NYSE:TOO) -4.8% premarket after announcing an offering of ~7M of its...

    Teekay Offshore Partners (NYSE:TOO) -4.8% premarket after announcing an offering of ~7M of its common units, representing limited partner interests. Net proceeds will be used to partially finance the Voyageur Spirit FPSO the company agreed to acquire from Teekay Corp. (NYSE:TK)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • AAL

    American Airlines (AAMRQ.PK) signs a deal that will allow SkyWest (NASDAQ:SKYW) to handle some...

    American Airlines (AAMRQ.PK) signs a deal that will allow SkyWest (NASDAQ:SKYW) to handle some of its flying. 23 regional jets that currently fly as American Eagle will switch to SkyWest. Shares of SKYW +4.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM
  • GBG

    Great Basin Gold (NYSEMKT:GBG) -46.9% premarket after suspending operations at its Burnstone...

    Great Basin Gold (NYSEMKT:GBG) -46.9% premarket after suspending operations at its Burnstone mine in South Africa, no longer able to fund the mine to achieve cash flow breakeven, which would have taken until May 2013 at current ramp-up rates. GBG is seeking to finance $30M-$40M in shutdown costs, but with "no certainty that such financing will be made available to the company."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • MEDW

    Mediware Information Systems (NASDAQ:MEDW) agrees to sell itself to PE firm Thoma Bravo for...

    Mediware Information Systems (NASDAQ:MEDW) agrees to sell itself to PE firm Thoma Bravo for $22/share in cash, about a 40% premium to yesterday's close. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 AM
  • CHK

    More on the Chesapeake (NYSE:CHK) sales: The Permian Basin assets alone fetched $3.3B - "a...

    More on the Chesapeake (NYSE:CHK) sales: The Permian Basin assets alone fetched $3.3B - "a little light," says Hedgeye's Kevin Kaiser, as most were looking for $4-6B. He also notes the company was unable to sell its undeveloped Midland Basin acreage and will need to hang onto it. The shares continue higher, +2.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:29 AM | 2 Comments

  • Gold, oil and related commodities also benefit from the ruling of Germany's Constitutional...

    Gold, oil and related commodities also benefit from the ruling of Germany's Constitutional Court. Crude futures are +0.5% to $97.64, gold +0.6% to $1745.70, silver +1.5% to $34.06. U.S. stock futures are having a ball as well: Dow +0.5%, S&P +0.5%, Nasdaq +0.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 AM

  • Have already been mostly higher, eurozone shares get a further lift following the decision of...

    Have already been mostly higher, eurozone shares get a further lift following the decision of Germany's Constitutional Court to approve the ESM. Euro Stoxx 50 +1.1%, London +0.2% after being in the red, Paris +0.6%, Frankfurt +0.8%, Milan +1.3%, Madrid +1.6%. The euro also gets a boost and hits $1.2896 before settling a bit to $1.2889, or +0.3%. Spanish and Italian 10-year bond yields are little changed.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 AM

  • European shares are mostly higher in early trading as Germany's Constitutional Court starts to...

    European shares are mostly higher in early trading as Germany's Constitutional Court starts to give its verdict on the legality of the ESM. The court was forecast to approve the rescue fund but with strings. Euro Stoxx 50 +0.5%, London -0.2%, Paris +0.2%, Frankfurt +0.1%, Madrid +0.6%, Milan +0.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 AM

  • Asian shares are broadly higher on confidence that Germany's Constitutional Court will today...

    Asian shares are broadly higher on confidence that Germany's Constitutional Court will today approve the eurozone's ESM rescue fund and that the Fed will announce more stimulus. However, says Sumitomo Mitsui's Katsunori Kitakura, "I feel that the market is getting a bit too excited about the chance of QE." Japan +1.7%, Hong Kong +1.1%, China -0.2%, India +0.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 AM
